tool_description: Empower your app with our Distance Calculation API! Accurately measure distances worldwide between any two locations. Seamless integration, versatile customization for various transportation modes, and real-time updates ensure precise, efficient, and up-to-date distance calculations. Enhance navigation, logistics, and user experience effortlessly
name: Distance API
title: Distance API

api_list.name: Calculate Truck Distance
api_list.description:
Customized Truck Routes: Generate truck-specific routes, factoring in truck dimensions, weight limitations, and road restrictions to ensure safe and efficient navigation.

Hazardous Materials Consideration: Seamlessly plan routes while adhering to regulations for transporting hazardous materials, providing crucial safety compliance.

Optimization Tools: Optimize routes based on various parameters such as vehicle dimensions, weight, and road conditions, enhancing efficiency and minimizing transportation costs.

required_parameters.name: waypoint1
required_parameters.description:
**Route Waypoints and ViaWaypoints**: A route is determined by a collection of waypoints and viaWaypoints, which represent intermediate locations that the route must traverse. The index (n value) for both waypoints and viaWaypoints is an integer starting with 0 or 1. It's essential to maintain sequential and consistent increments by 1 for waypoint and viaWaypoint index values.

Both waypoint and viaWaypoint locations can be specified as:

- A Point, depicting geographical coordinates.
- A landmark identifier.
- An address description.

You can include a maximum of 25 waypoints or viaWaypoints within a request. Notably, the start and end points of the route cannot be designated as viaWaypoints.

**Examples:**
**waypoint.1**=47.610,-122.107 [Point]
**wp.1**=Seattle,WA [landmark]
**waypoint.1**=1%20Microsoft%20Way%20Redmond%20WA [address]
**&waypoint.1**=Seattle&viaWaypoint.2=Kirkland&waypoint.3=Redmond [viaWaypoint]

These examples demonstrate various ways to define waypoints and viaWaypoints, enabling you to specify locations either by coordinates, landmarks, or addresses within your request for route calculations.

required_parameters.name: viaWaypoint1
required_parameters.description:
**Route Waypoints and ViaWaypoints**: A route is determined by a collection of waypoints and viaWaypoints, which represent intermediate locations that the route must traverse. The index (n value) for both waypoints and viaWaypoints is an integer starting with 0 or 1. It's essential to maintain sequential and consistent increments by 1 for waypoint and viaWaypoint index values.

Both waypoint and viaWaypoint locations can be specified as:

- A Point, depicting geographical coordinates.
- A landmark identifier.
- An address description.

You can include a maximum of 25 waypoints or viaWaypoints within a request. Notably, the start and end points of the route cannot be designated as viaWaypoints.

**Examples:**
**waypoint.1**=47.610,-122.107 [Point]
**wp.1**=Seattle,WA [landmark]
**waypoint.1**=1%20Microsoft%20Way%20Redmond%20WA [address]
**&waypoint.1**=Seattle&viaWaypoint.2=Kirkland&waypoint.3=Redmond [viaWaypoint]

These examples demonstrate various ways to define waypoints and viaWaypoints, enabling you to specify locations either by coordinates, landmarks, or addresses within your request for route calculations.

optional_parameters.name: avoid
optional_parameters.description:
Determines road preferences when generating a driving route. Accepts a comma-separated list of values from the following options, influencing the use of highways, toll roads, ferries, and specific driving maneuvers in the route. Options include:

**highways**: Avoids highways' utilization in the route.
**tolls**: Steers clear of toll roads during the route.
**ferry**: Prevents routes from including ferry segments.
**minimizeHighways**: Strives to limit the use of highways in the route.
**minimizeTolls**: Seeks to reduce the reliance on toll roads.
**borderCrossing**: Avoids crossing country or regional borders along the route.
**minimizeDrivingSideTurn**: Minimizes right turns in regions with right-side driving or left turns in regions with left-side driving.
**minimizeAgainstDrivingSideTurn**: Minimizes left turns in right-side-driving regions or right turns in left-side-driving regions.
**minimizeUTurn**: Aims to reduce U-turns along the route.

Note: If multiple options for a road type are specified, the most restrictive option takes precedence. For instance, if both 'highways' and 'minimizeHighways' are set, the 'highways' option prevails, resulting in the avoidance of all highways.

optional_parameters.name: optimize
optional_parameters.description:
Specifies the parameters determining route optimization. It can take on one of the following values:

**time [default]**: The route is computed to minimize travel time. It doesn't consider traffic information.
**timeWithTraffic**: The route is calculated to minimize travel time, incorporating current traffic information for optimization.
